x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Smallholder farmers in Nigeria produce most of the nation’s food, yet they earn the least. They face: Limited access to buyers and fair prices Post-harvest losses due to poor logistics Lack of transparency in middlemen transactions No digital record of produce quality or reliability
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine Studio — build farmer profiles, listings, and transaction workflows.

IntegrationHub - connect to logistics APIs (e.g., GIG Logistics, Kobo360) and payment gateways.

Flow Designer - automate order matching and delivery coordination.

Performance Analytics - dashboards showing farm-to-market times and waste reduction metrics.

Customer Service Management (CSM) - support farmers and buyers.

Mobile App - enable access for rural farmers with low bandwidth.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with SMS/USSD for farmers without smartphones.
  • Payment APIs (e.g., Flutterwave) for secure transactions.
  • GIS or Google Maps API for farm-to-market route optimization.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Onboarding farmers in low-digital-literacy areas.
  • Ensuring fair price transparency and trust between farmers and buyers.
  • Reliable last-mile logistics.
